title:
Strange and pseudo-differentiable functions with applications to prime
  partitions
authors: Anji Dong, Nicolas Robles, Alexandru Zaharescu and Dirk Zeindler
abstract:
Let $\mathfrak{p}_{\mathbb{P}_r}(n)$ denote the number of partitions of $n$
into $r$-full primes. We use the Hardy-Littlewood circle method to find the
asymptotic of $\mathfrak{p}_{\mathbb{P}_r}(n)$ as $n \to \infty$. This extends
previous results in the literature of partitions into primes. We also show an
analogue result involving convolutions of von Mangoldt functions and the zeros
of the Riemann zeta-function. To handle the resulting non-principal major arcs
we introduce the definition of strange functions and pseudo-differentiability.
